sources.data_found: NSF Award #1925633 (2019) funded the 'BlueShark' cluster, specifying 'GPU nodes' in the abstract, corresponding to the V100 deployment.

student_data.notes: Data extracted directly from the Florida Tech Fact Book 2023-24 (Fall 2023 Enrollment) for the 'Computer Science' major within the Department of Computer Engineering and Sciences. Does not include 'Software Engineering' (118 UG) or 'Computer Engineering' (134 UG) majors. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Research Computing page lists legacy nodes with K80 accelerators (2 nodes x 4 GPUs).

gpu_resources.notes: Florida Tech's primary HPC cluster 'BlueShark' lists 2 GPU nodes with 2x V100s each (Total 4). No public evidence found of newer H100/A100 deployments in the central research computing documentation or press releases as of May 2025. NSF awards database search confirms the 2019 funding for this hardware. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

compute_credits.description: No public data found regarding cloud compute credit allocations.

analysis_notes: Student data is highly accurate, sourced from the official university Fact Book. GPU data reflects the on-premise 'BlueShark' cluster found in Research Computing documentation. While the university has an AI/Cybersecurity focus (L3Harris Institute), no separate, publicly specified compute cluster with modern hardware (A100/H100) was found beyond the central IT provision.
